      Notifies the player that a new turn has started.
      Specified by:
      newTurn in interface UI
      Parameters:
      playing - A boolean indicating if it's the player's turn to play.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs.

    • resumingTurn

      Resumes the player's turn or continues waiting for the turn.
      Specified by:
      resumingTurn in interface UI
      Parameters:
      playing - A boolean indicating if it's the player's turn to play.

    • askOrder

      public void askOrder()
      Asks the player to choose the order of dropping tiles. This method sets the current state to choosing order.
      Specified by:
      askOrder in interface UI

    • lastTurn

      public void lastTurn(boolean playing)
      Handles the last turn of the game for the player. If the player is currently playing, it sets the current state to choosing action and prompts the player to choose an action. If the player is not playing, it sets the current state to waiting turn.
      Specified by:
      lastTurn in interface UI
      Parameters:
      playing - true if the player is currently playing, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the method execution.

    • chat

      public void chat()
      Enters the chat mode for the player. Sets the current state to chatting and prompts the player to send a message. Messages can be sent to all players or privately by starting the message with "@nickname".

    • askColumn

      public void askColumn()
      Prompts the player to choose a column to drop their tiles. Sets the current state to choosing column and provides a message with instructions.
      Specified by:
      askColumn in interface UI

    • chooseAction

      public void chooseAction() throws RemoteException
      Sets the current state to choosing action. Allows the player to choose an action to perform during their turn.
      Specified by:
      chooseAction in interface UI
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • checkAction

      public void checkAction(String input) throws RemoteException
      Checks the player's input and updates the current state accordingly. Performs different actions based on the input provided by the player.
      Parameters:
      input - the player's input
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • askNumber

      public void askNumber() throws RemoteException
      Prompts the user to enter the number of players that will take part in the game. Reads the input from the user and validates it. If the input is a valid number of players (between 2 and 4), it calls the listener's numberPartecipantsSetting() method to handle the setting of the number of players. If the input is invalid, error messages are displayed and the user is prompted again.
      Specified by:
      askNumber in interface UI
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • askNickName

      public void askNickName() throws RemoteException
      Prompts the user to choose a nickname for the game. Reads the input from the user and validates it. If the input is a valid nickname (not empty), it calls the listener's clientNickNameSetting() method to handle the setting of the nickname. If the input is invalid (empty), error messages are displayed and the user is prompted again.
      Specified by:
      askNickName in interface UI
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • askExistingNickname

      public void askExistingNickname()
      Prompts the user who was disconnected from a game to enter their old nickname. Reads the input from the user and validates it. If the input is a valid nickname (not empty), it calls the listener's checkingExistingNickname() method to handle the validation of the nickname. If the input is invalid (empty), error messages are displayed and the user is prompted to enter a valid nickname.
      Specified by:
      askExistingNickname in interface UI
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a runtime exception occurs while handling the existing nickname check

    • warning

      public void warning(Warnings e) throws RemoteException
      Handles different types of warnings received from the server. Based on the type of warning, appropriate actions are taken. The method throws a RemoteException if a remote exception occurs while handling the warning.
      Specified by:
      warning in interface UI
      Parameters:
      e - the type of warning received from the server
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote exception occurs while handling the warning

    • lastTurnReached

      public void lastTurnReached(String nickname)
      Notifies that the last turn has been reached for a player.
      Specified by:
      lastTurnReached in interface UI
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who completed their shelf

    • printShelves

      public void printShelves(Map<String,Shelf> playerShelves)
      Prints the shelves of players with their corresponding tiles.
      Parameters:
      playerShelves - a map containing the player names as keys and their Shelf objects as values

      nickname - the nickname of the player

    • printFinalPoints

      Specified by:
      printFinalPoints in interface UI
      Parameters:
      chart - a map containing player names as keys and their corresponding points as values
      winnerNickname - the nickname of the winner

    • printGame

      public void printGame(GameView gameView)

      Specified by:
      printGame in interface UI
      Parameters:
      gameView - the GameView object representing the game state to be printed
      Throws:
